section.title: Function
section.p: Defines the page size, in bytes, for on-disk database pages for tables or indexes used during table or index creation. Set this property prior to issuing the CREATE TABLE or CREATE INDEX statement. This value will be used for the lifetime of the newly created conglomerates.

section.title: Valid conglomerates
section.p: Tables and indexes, including the indexes created to enforce constraints.

section.title: Default
section.p: automatically tunes for the database page size. If you have long columns, the default page size for the table is set to 32768 bytes. Otherwise, the default is 4096 bytes.

section.title: Valid values
section.p: Page size can only be one the following values: 4096, 8192, 16384, or 32768 bytes. If you specify an invalid value, uses the default value.

codeblock.b: -- changing the default for the system derby.storage.pageSize=8192 -- changing the default for the database CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.storage.pageSize', '8192')

section.title: Dynamic or static
section.p: This property is dynamic; if you change it while is running, the change takes effect immediately. For information about dynamic changes to properties, see .
